citation.article-title: Methylohalobius crimeensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a moderately halophilic, methanotrophic bacterium isolated from hypersaline lakes of Crimea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Methylohalobius gen. nov.

Methylohalobius (Me.thy.lo.ha.lo′bi.us. N.L. neut. n. methyl, methylis the methyl group; Gr. masc. n. hals, halos salt; Gr. masc. n. bios life; N.L. masc. n. Methylohalobius salt-requiring, methyl-using bacterium).
Gram-negative, polymorphic, coccoid and spindle-shaped cells that are 1 μm (0·5–1·6 μm) in width and 2·1 μm (1·6–3·2 μm) in length.
Reproduce by normal cell division.
Cells occur singly, in pairs or in short chains, but do not form rosettes.
Motile.
Resting stages (exospores, Azotobacter-type cysts, or lipid cysts) not present.
Possess a typical type I intracytoplasmic membrane system.
Do not possess soluble methane monooxygenase.
Moderate halophiles growing from 0·2 up to 2·5 M NaCl (optimum 1·0–1·5 M).
Temperature optimum for growth is 30 °C (range <15 to >42 °C; no growth occurs at 50 °C).
Grow between pH 6·5 and 7·5.
Grow on methane and methanol.
Utilize C1 compounds via the ribulose monophosphate pathway.
Do not fix atmospheric nitrogen.
The major PLFA is 18 : 1ω7.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain of the type species is 58·7 mol%.

Phylogenetically belongs to the ‘Gammaproteobacteria’ (type I methanotrophic bacteria or Methylococcaceae); the closest methanotrophic bacterial neighbours are the thermophilic methanotroph strain HB and Methylococcus capsulatus Bath.
Contains one species, the type species Methylohalobius crimeensis.
Habitats are pH-neutral hypersaline wetlands.
